p: GC/MS analysis of the leucocarpa variety (first five accessions in Table S1) showed a wide variability, and the main components ( Table 2) were α-pinene, limonene, and 1,8-cineole. In RUM14, α-pinene reached a high concentration, and the lowest was in V8, while limonene was characterized in V3 and V8 selections with high concentrations. The majority of 1,8-cineole was concentrated in V8 and RUM6. It is interesting to note that linalyl acetate was present only in RUM14.
